title: 'Death cross' pattern appears in Dow transports chart
text: The Dow Jones Transportation Average DJT, -0.03% inched less than 0.1% lower in afternoon trading, erasing an earlier gain of as much as 0.4%, as the index is on track to produce bearish "death cross" chart pattern. A death cross refers to when the 50-day moving average (DMA), a short-term trend tracker, crosses below the 200-day moving average, which many use to define the longer-term trend. The cross is believed by many chart watchers to mark the spot a short-term pullback transitions into a longer-term downtrend. The Dow transports 50-DMA fell to 10,259 in afternoon trading while the 200-DMA rose to 10,270. The death cross erases the bullish opposite "golden cross" that had appeared on April 25. The last death cross appeared on Nov. 26, 2018. The Dow transports' death cross comes three sessions after one appeared in the Russell 2000's RUT, +0.00% chart. Meanwhile, the Dow Jones Industrial Average's DJIA, -0.24% 50-DMA is 2.3% above its 200-DMA and the S&P 500's 50-DMA is 3.4% above its 200-DMA.
